metadata.title: If a PHY-LSI connected to the EtherC/EDMAC port of an RX microcontroller suddenly stops responding, how does phy_read() behave and how should the application behave?

sections.content:
Question:
If a PHY-LSI connected to the EtherC/EDMAC port of an RX microcontroller suddenly stops responding, how does phy_read() behave and how should the application behave? 
Answer:
If the PHY-LSI stops responding, 0xffff is read as the 16-bit value from the MDC/MDIO that is performing clock synchronous serial communication. Therefore, if phy_read() returns 0xffff, call R_ETHER_Close() to stop the Ethernet communication. 
Suitable Products
RX
